page.title: 15OAKHILL MANOR RAILWAY
page.content: Oakhill Manor is a large house in a small estate belonging to Mr.&Mrs. Walter Harper. It is a museum with a large model railway around the grounds. It is situated in the village of Oakhill along Galley Batch Lane. The Museum has lots of model trains, boats, planes and ships. It also has victorian clothes and furniture. The train rides take about 5 minutes around the whole track and run from the car park to the house. Rides are taken on trains pulled by one of the three locomotives; a diesel and 2 steam trains. There is a cafe and a gift shop where you can buy souvenirs. Other attractions are the lanscaped gardens with fish ponds, 2 miniature ponies and a large picnic area. It also offers seasonal employment for the villagers.
